missionTitle: NASA’s Artemis I Spacecraft Prepped to Depart to Ohio Facility
summary: NASA's Artemis I Orion spacecraft is being readied in Florida for testing in Ohio after its 1.4 million-mile journey and ocean splashdown.

missionTitle: One Year Ago: Artemis I Lifts Off
summary: NASA's Artemis I mission launched on Nov. 16, 2022, and concluded with a splashdown on Dec. 11, after orbiting the Moon and traveling 270,000 miles from Earth.

Following two Artemis test missions, Artemis III will mark humanity’s first return to the lunar surface in more than 50 years. NASA will make history by sending astronauts to explore a region near the Moon’s South Pole.

missionTitle: First Artemis Crew Trains for Mission Around Moon
summary: Four astronauts are training for Artemis II, NASA's first crewed mission on the SLS rocket and Orion spacecraft, to test life-support systems for future Moon missions.
Artemis II will be NASA's first crewed deep space flight, testing the Orion spacecraft and SLS rocket over a 10-day mission to pave the way for future Moon landings.

missionTitle: A Walk Through the Rainbow with PACE
summary: NASA's PACE mission aims to use the visible wavelengths of the electromagnetic spectrum, the colors of the rainbow, to gather new data on the world's skies and seas.
Plankton, Aerosol Cloud Ocean Ecosystem (PACE) will advance the assessment of ocean health by measuring the distribution of phytoplankton, tiny plants and algae that sustain the marine food web.

missionTitle: NASA’s PACE Mission Will Uncover New Information About Health of Our Oceans
summary: NASA's PACE mission will use an ocean color instrument to study the impact of climate change on oceans, clouds, and airborne particles.

missionTitle: Two Rovers to Roll on Mars Again: Curiosity and Mars 2020
summary: Next summer, NASA's Mars 2020 rover, distinct from Curiosity, will join the exploration of Mars, focusing on the search for ancient life.

The world's first reusable spacecraft launched like a rocket, maneuvered in Earth orbit like a spacecraft and landed like an airplane. It was comprised of the orbiter, the main engines, the external tank, and the solid rocket boosters.

missionTitle: NASA’s Webb Delivers Deepest Infrared Image of Universe Yet
summary: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope has delivered the deepest and sharpest infrared image of the distant universe so far. Webb’s First Deep Field is galaxy cluster SMACS 0723, and it is teeming with thousands of galaxies – including the faintest objects ever observed in the infrared.
Visit Hubble in orbit and investigate how it works in the 360-degree virtual tour.

missionTitle: NASA’s Webb Sheds Light on Galaxy Evolution, Black Holes
summary: Webb’s new image shows in rare detail how interacting galaxies trigger star formation in each other and how gas in galaxies is being disturbed
The Human Landing System (HLS) is the mode of transportation that will take astronauts to the lunar surface as part of the Artemis program, including the first woman and the first person of color.

missionTitle: NASA Selects Companies to Develop Commercial Destinations in Space
summary: NASA has signed agreements with three U.S. companies to develop designs of space stations and other commercial destinations in space.
